description:
Types of non-personal taxes

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
71231 Comparison of non-personal taxes

Definition:
Non-personal taxes, also called taxes on objects, are levied
on individual assets. They are payable by whoever the assets
are attributable to. In contrast to taxes on persons (e.g.
income tax and corporation tax), these taxes do not consider
a person's ability to pay but refer to an object, something
"real". Non-personal taxes currently comprise real property
tax and trade tax. Pursuant to Article 106 paragraph 6 of
the German Basic Law (GG), revenue from these taxes as a
rule accrues to the municipalities.
